c:simple-property.name: afterReloading

operation.name: clear

metric.description: Total number of group definitions in the system
The number of auto-recalculating group definitions in the system
Total number of resource groups managed by some group definition
Average time it took (in milliseconds) to recalculate DynaGroup members for those GroupDefinition's whose timeout expired

operation.name: clear
operation.description: Clear the collected metric data and start collecting anew

operation.description: View statistical information about each subsystem call into the server

metric.description: Total number of commands that were received but failed to be processed successfully
Total number of commands that were received and successfully processed
Total number of commands that were received regardless of their success or failure

Total number of commands that were received but were dropped, usually due to a limit reached in the server that prohibits more commands from being processed until commands currently being processed are finished.
Total number of commands that were received but were not processed usually due to the suspension of global command processing.
Average time it took (in milliseconds) to process incoming commands that are ultimately successful

c:group.name: concurrencylimits
c:group.c:description: Limits the number of concurrent requests to a particular subsystem before requests start getting dropped

c:simple-property.name: GlobalConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of incoming commands from agents that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: InventoryReportConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of inventory reports that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: AvailabilityReportConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of availability reports that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: InventorySyncConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of inventory synchronizations that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: ContentReportConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of content reports that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: ContentDownloadConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of package version downloads that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: MeasurementReportConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of measurement reports that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: MeasurementScheduleRequestConcurrencyLimit
c:simple-property.description: Number of measurement schedule requests that can be processed concurrently; if zero or less, there is no limit

c:simple-property.name: MaintenanceModeAtStartup
c:simple-property.description: If true, the server will start in Maintenance Mode, regardless of the state it was in when it was shutdown. Therefore, if true, no agents will be allowed to talk to this server when it starts up.

service.description: Details on the content source server plugin subsystem

c:simple-property.name: nameTemplate
c:simple-property.default: RHQ Server Content Source Server Plugin Subsystem

c:simple-property.name: descriptionTemplate
c:simple-property.default: Details on the content source server plugin subsystem

operation.name: startPluginContainer
operation.description: Starts the plugin container which will load and initialize all content source plugins. Once started, content source feed data will be able to start to flow

operation.name: stopPluginContainer
operation.description: Stops the plugin container which will shutdown all content source plugins. Once stopped, content source feed data will not be able to flow

operation.name: restartPluginContainer
operation.description: Convienence operation that first stops and then immediately restarts the plugin container.

metric.description: The location where this plugin container expects to find all of its plugins.
The location that the plugin uses to store transient files. Dependency jars found in plugins will be stored here to help build plugin classloaders.
